NarrPara.Content: First, we begin by defining the set of positions on the board. We define the numbering on the board as if it were a square (6x7), but don't include the positions not on the board. Hence define
We then define a relationship $next$, between cell positions, which indicates the neighbours of cells.
Next, we define the class $Circle$, which represents a circle on the board. To move the circle, a direction is entered. Hence, we define the $DIR$, which represents directions.
Now, we define a class $BlackCircle$ that extends the $Circle$ class to represent a black circle by including a $count$ for the number of times a circle is moved.
Now, we define the $Shunting$ class, which maintains the state of the board.
